Comments_List:
We talked about OT. So much OT. I was skeptical at first when the syllabus said we'd only be working in OT for a full semester, but OT really just has that much to offer... until the last week of class when you see what all OT can't do...
We also got to make a novel OT analysis for an alternation and language of our choice.

I don't feel like there are really any big weaknesses in this course. I successfully learned about all things OT. What happened in grad group is a mystery to the undergrad, kinda wish I knew what was going on sometimes but I guessed I never asked either. I suppose it didn't affect me in the end.
Definitely. If you want to learn more about phonology, this is a great class to take after Phon 1. I can guarantee a small class size, so there'll be great teacher-student interaction.
